description: go-playground: add information about the playground and its limitations

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go-playground

On Wed, Oct 10, 2012 at 8:14 AM,  <r@golang.org> wrote:

> easier for the Spielgrund to cache by ....

Spielplatz surely.

--Benny.

-- 
The first essential in chemistry is that you should perform practical
work and conduct experiments, for he who performs not practical work
nor makes experiments will never attain the least degree of mastery.
        -- Abu Musa Jabir ibn Hayyan (721-815)

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go-playground/source/detail?r=8bddac097a9e ***

go-playground: add information about the playground and its limitations

R=r, dsymonds, bsiegert
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6643056

https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html File goplay/edit.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html#newcode69 goplay/edit.html:69: There are also limits on execution time, and CPU and memory usage. on execution time and on CPU and memory usage https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html#newcode74 goplay/edit.html:74: (notably absent are network and file system access). rephrase. this makes it sound more stripped than it is. "it's mostly there, except for.." https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html#newcode76 goplay/edit.html:76: outside world is via standard output. by printing to standard output (stderr?) https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html#newcode83 goplay/edit.html:83: This makes programs more cachable by giving them deterministic output. easier for the Spielgrund to cache by .... avoid the word cachable https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html#newcode87 goplay/edit.html:87: The Playground should use the latest stable release of Go.
s/should use/uses/

PTAL https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html File goplay/edit.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html#newcode69 goplay/edit.html:69: There are also limits on execution time, and CPU and memory usage. On 2012/10/10 06:14:56, r wrote: > on execution time and on CPU and memory usage Done. https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html#newcode74 goplay/edit.html:74: (notably absent are network and file system access). On 2012/10/10 06:14:56, r wrote: > rephrase. this makes it sound more stripped than it is. "it's mostly there, > except for.." Done. https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html#newcode76 goplay/edit.html:76: outside world is via standard output. On 2012/10/10 06:14:56, r wrote: > by printing to standard output > (stderr?) Done. https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html#newcode83 goplay/edit.html:83: This makes programs more cachable by giving them deterministic output. On 2012/10/10 06:14:56, r wrote: > easier for the Spielgrund to cache by .... > avoid the word cachable Done. https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html#newcode87 goplay/edit.html:87: The Playground should use the latest stable release of Go.
On 2012/10/10 06:14:56, r wrote: > s/should use/uses/ Done.

PTAL https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html File goplay/edit.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html#newcode69 goplay/edit.html:69: There are also limits on execution time, and CPU and memory usage. On 2012/10/10 06:14:56, r wrote: > on execution time and on CPU and memory usage Done. https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html#newcode74 goplay/edit.html:74: (notably absent are network and file system access). On 2012/10/10 06:14:56, r wrote: > rephrase. this makes it sound more stripped than it is. "it's mostly there, > except for.." Done. https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html#newcode76 goplay/edit.html:76: outside world is via standard output. On 2012/10/10 06:14:56, r wrote: > by printing to standard output > (stderr?) Done. https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html#newcode83 goplay/edit.html:83: This makes programs more cachable by giving them deterministic output. On 2012/10/10 06:14:56, r wrote: > easier for the Spielgrund to cache by .... > avoid the word cachable Done. https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/5001/goplay/edit.html#newcode87 goplay/edit.html:87: The Playground should use the latest stable release of Go.
On 2012/10/10 06:14:56, r wrote: > s/should use/uses/ Done.

https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/10001/goplay/edit.html
File goplay/edit.html (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/10001/goplay/edit.html#newcode29
goplay/edit.html:29: if (about.is(':visible')) {
jQuery has a toggle action. Can you use that instead?

https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/10001/goplay/edit.html#newcode68
goplay/edit.html:68: They must be single-threaded (but they may use many goroutines).
Technically, being single threaded is not a limitation on the program, but on the execution environment for that program. The limitations of the program are in the next paragraph. Maybe:

There are limitations to the programs that can be run in the playground. <most of std lib>. <only comm is stdout/stderr>. The program is restricted to running in a single thread (but may use many goroutines).

PTAL

https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/10001/goplay/edit.html
File goplay/edit.html (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/10001/goplay/edit.html#newcode29
goplay/edit.html:29: if (about.is(':visible')) {
On 2012/10/10 11:33:15, dsymonds wrote:
> jQuery has a toggle action. Can you use that instead?

I'd prefer not to, as clicking the text itself can hide it, which would confuse the toggle state.

https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/10001/goplay/edit.html#newcode68
goplay/edit.html:68: They must be single-threaded (but they may use many goroutines).
On 2012/10/10 11:33:15, dsymonds wrote:
> Technically, being single threaded is not a limitation on the program, but on
> the execution environment for that program. The limitations of the program are
> in the next paragraph. Maybe:
> 
> There are limitations to the programs that can be run in the playground. <most
> of std lib>. <only comm is stdout/stderr>. The program is restricted to running
> in a single thread (but may use many goroutines).

Done.

https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/1003/goplay/edit.html
File goplay/edit.html (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/1003/goplay/edit.html#newcode67
goplay/edit.html:67: There are limitations to the programs that can be run in the playground.
as a paragraph by itself this sentence is odd. maybe go with a <ul> for the following paragraphs (with slight rewording for flow) and put a colon on the end of this sentence

PTAL

https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/1003/goplay/edit.html
File goplay/edit.html (right):

https://codereview.appspot.com/6643056/diff/1003/goplay/edit.html#newcode67
goplay/edit.html:67: There are limitations to the programs that can be run in the playground.
On 2012/10/10 22:15:27, r wrote:
> as a paragraph by itself this sentence is odd. maybe go with a <ul> for the
> following paragraphs (with slight rewording for flow) and put a colon on the end
> of this sentence

Done.
